data.title: Was awesome!
data.text: Great food and atmosphere. The smoked salmon was off the charts, art work very nice and service was superb.

data.title: Charming Sheltered Outdoor Patio
data.text: Good desserts, very friendly service, nice salads and soups, a downtown favorite, You can get customer appreciation cards for coffee. Lots of choice for tea and coffee.

data.title: Nice, not too hip coffeehouse.
data.text:
This coffeehouse is the less trendy and hip than the other one (Kopi), but I rather like that. You won't feel out of place there reading a Raymond Chandler detective novel instead of Vasko Popa's latest poetry release. I've often found it a pleasant place to get a light lunch, some good, dark coffee, and spend an hour grading papers. 

I pretty much stick with either espresso or their (quite reasonably priced) organic coffees, so I can't really tell you much about their various fancy coffees, but they do have all of them-- macchiatos, caffecitos, mochas, whatever. I've always found the coffees to be quite fresh, robust, and delicious. I've not yet had an acid bath or  a bland coffee there. And they serve a nice but small menu of sandwiches. I recommend the Cuban; with a couple or small group the hummus plate is nice; and on those cold winter days they have some delicious soups. They also have wraps and salads, but I've not yet tried them.

It is vegetarian and kid friendly, crowded mostly just in the morning rush and at lunch time, and I always enjoy my visit.

data.title: Delicious, but expensive
data.text: My boyfriend and I stumbled onto this place last Wednesday. We were looking for a quick bite to eat before a comedy show downtown. We weren't looking for a cafe, but this place had amazing tasting sandwiches and soup and I'm so glad we stopped here. I was also craving something cold, so the 4 berry smoothie fit the bill perfectly. I'd definitely go back, but not until I get a couple pay checks. It cost about $30 for a couple sandwiches with sides and 2 smoothies. I'd rather go to a mid-scale sit-down restaurant if I'm going to be paying that. However, it's a good one to keep in the back pocket if we're crunched for time downtown and want some good eats. All inclusive atmosphere too, which is great, even though we stuck out like a couple of backwoods sore thumbs.

data.title: Jules
data.text:
Good experience 
We had a wrap and sandwich both were very good. Went with my daughter and grand children for lunch was hoping to sit outside unfortunately all the tables with umbrellas were taken . Suggestion would be all tables have an umbrella for shade

data.title: Great, quiet little cafe in downtown Champaign
data.text:
Aroma is a great little cafe in downtown Champaign. A quiet place with a nice little backyard, Aroma serves a variety of good coffees, smoothies etc. They also have basic coffee-shop food (hot and cold sandwiches, soups, salads) which you can consume on the spot or take out.

The staff is very friendly and the overall atmosphere is peaceful. Some nice photographs of Champaign hang on the wall. This is a great place to sip a cup of coffee while reading the paper or a book. Aroma offers free WiFi.

While I wouldn't say that Aroma does not welcome kids, I think they welcome everyone, most of the clients seem to be engaged in reading or working on their computers, so I think they value the peaceful atmosphere.

A nice, quiet spot in downtown Champaign.

data.title: Pleasant place to have a cuppa!
data.text: Good coffee in a nice college bistro setting. Sat and read for about 45 minutes and enjoyed the environment and people watching.  Their initial coffee had cool a little too much for them, so they brewed another pot of Peruvian. Good service...

data.title: The best Coffee in town
data.text: Early in the morning to get you started or for an afternoon energy kick this is the place to go. The barista knows your name and order just after couple of visits, my favorite the traditional macchiato.

data.title: One of my favorite coffee/lunch spots downtown
data.text: There are lots of coffee spots downtown and I'll be honest when I say that I like them all. But I find myself at Aroma quite a bit. The coffee is tasty and the patio area is really nice in the warmer months. But in the winter, their soup is my jam, especially the tomato bisque. And unlike some other places in the area, you actually get more than a tiny cup of it so it really warms you up. Oh, and did I mention they can make banana white mochas? Yum.

data.title: Great food
data.text: They have a great breakfast sandwich that you can get on gluten free bread or a bagel! Staff are friendly and there is also free WiFi. Great location. A lot of baked goods and some packaged cookies as well.

data.title: Local cafe in college town
data.text: I visited the cafe while waiting for a train to Chicago. The coffee was delicious, and the bagel I ordered was good. It was a weekday, but there were many other people present giving it a blossoming yet not crowded vibe. Definitely worth a visit!

data.title: Feels Like Home
data.text: Amazing scones, breads and pastries; capps, smoothies, teas -- all surpassed only by the warm and welcoming staff.  No fluff -- just genuinely great coffee and pastries served by a friendly and knowledgeable staff.

data.title: Love the Danish!
data.text: Visited this cute shop about two weeks ago.  My hubby and I like to try local coffee places, and Aroma delivers. Very much 'local,' so a nice change from big chains. Such cute decor. Love the coffee and the delicious cheese danish! Also, cinni rolls as big as a head with gigantic dollops of cream! Yum!

data.title: "Great Little Cafe"!
data.text: My first visit to Aroma Cafe was on Monday, August 17. What a quaint, fun little coffee shop with both indoor/outdoor seating. The food was delicious, large helpings and reasonably priced. My cherry rose green tea was fabulous as well. Everyone in our party of four loved their food. Can't wait to come back!

data.title: Outstanding Coffee Great Specials Fast Service
data.text: Aroma is a great local place in the heart of downtown Champaign.  Very friendly staff lots of menu options, VERY reasonable prices and OUTSTANDING coffee. They serve a terrific Lox and Bagel with cream cheese for something like $5.00.  I don't know how they do it.  Very nice food, nice small non-corporate with a friendly vibe and wifi.  Try it you will like it.  It is also right next door to Pekara Bakery which is also outstanding.

data.title: Nice spot for lunch
data.text: My son and I stopped here over Mother's Weekend for U of I. There is seating inside, but since it was a beautiful day we opted to sit outside. We had a very nice lunch. The food is fresh and the portions are generous and service was pleasant. Aroma has a nice menu of sandwiches and salads along with sweet treats.  I can see were this place can get busy with students and their laptops, but that's any coffee cafe in a college town. We also had cappuccino's that were very good. I wouldn't hesitate to stop here again.

data.title: Excellent coffee
data.text: Excellent coffee , nice place just downtown, was surprised from the quality of the coffee - 10 times better then starbucks

data.title: I like it!
data.text:
Comp wifi and comfortable seating both inside and out. Love the varieties of ice tea and cookies. 
The staff is super friendly!

data.title: Good move if not in a hurry
data.text: We ventured out to aroma Café after church on a Sunday. It was busy, but not overcrowded. Lots of people on their laptops. We dined in. There were only a couple servers, and so it backs up when people are ordering specialty coffees. Don't go here if you're in a hurry. The coffee is solid, and the pastries pretty tasty. Looks like they bring everything in. I like the ceramic mugs. You can sit outside when the weather is nice. "Book it to Aroma Cafe."

data.title: Classic Environment
data.text: Great food, great drinks served in ceramic (my favorite) and great place to meet up with people, inside or out.  On street parking is usually easy in that area.  Servers are friendly.  Love this place.
